DataElement.preferredName: Neurologic Disease or Disorder Adult Patient Dental Treatment Frequency
DataElement.preferredDefinition: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A human who has reached reproductive age._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
